title: White House Covid-19 Response Chief to Leave Administration
sub_head: Dr. Ashish Jha, dean of the Brown University School of Public Health, will be taking over the role
body:
Jeff Zients, who has led the White House’s Covid-19 response for more than a year, will be leaving the job in April as the Biden administration navigates a new strategy for the next phase of the pandemic.
He will be replaced by Dr. Ashish Jha, who is the dean of Brown University School of Public Health and a well-known public-health leader. Dr. Jha has championed many of the measures the administration has used to combat Covid-19.
